subject: Programming
title: How Circuits Add Numbers
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Circuits Add Numbers.

hook.text: Your calculator adds millions of numbers per second. Under the hood, it's just flipping gates.

buildup.text: A half adder combines AND and XOR gates to add two single bits and produce a sum and carry.

discovery.text: Chain multiple adders together and you get a full adder that handles multi-digit binary addition.

twist.text: There is no multiplication circuit. Computers multiply by adding the same number repeatedly.

climax.text: All math your computer does â€” from spreadsheets to physics â€” starts with tiny bit additions.

punchline.text: All computation is just addition in disguise.
